thread.title: Washington Nationals teammates Jonathan Papelbon and Bryce Harper brawl in dugout
thread.title_full: Washington Nationals teammates Jonathan Papelbon and Bryce Harper brawl in dugout

author: Claire Siracusa
title: Washington Nationals teammates Jonathan Papelbon and Bryce Harper brawl in dugout
text:

Teammates trade blows in the dugout Two Washington Nationals teammates come to blows in the dugout during their MLB game against the Philadelphia Phillies.
PT0M51S 620 349 It's not uncommon for tempers to flare on the field, but it's a little less regular to see two teammates going head-to-head, particularly in full view of a stadium-full of spectators.
But that was the case in the MLB on Monday (AEST), when two Washington Nationals teammates came to blows in the dugout, mid-game against Philadelphia.
During the eighth inning, Bryce Harper and Jonathan Papelbon had to be separated by teammates as they brawled with the the game tied at 4-4.
Jonathan Papelbon had Bryce Harper by the throat. Photo: Getty Images
Harper is an outfielder and National League MVP favourite. Papelbon is a relief pitcher.
Advertisement The disagreement apparently sparked when Harper jogged towards first base as he was out via a routine fly ball. There was speculation that Papelbon was unhappy with the lack intent and effort shown by Harper on his way to first.
As Harper walked off, out, the two began yelling at each other before Papelbon grabbed his teammate around the neck and the physical fighting began.
Harper didn't take the field in the ninth, but Papelbon did. When he was eventually pulled (he gave up five runs in a poor appearance), the fans booed him from the field.
The Nationals gave up eight runs in the ninth inning before eventually losing the game 12-5 to the cellar-dwelling Phillies.
After the game, Papelbon reportedly apologised and said he was the one in the wrong. Harper apparently accepted the apology, saying he didn't care and the situation was "like brothers fighting".
It has been a poor season for the Nationals, with talk that their manager has lost the players. The team was eliminated from playoff contention on Sunday (AEST).
